data.title: Now You Know: Tribute shows salute music’s greats
data.meta_description: It’s a series of tribute performances showcasing some of the world’s most famous musical artists. Performances are at the Rose History Auditorium.
data.text:
It’s a series of tribute performances showcasing some of the world’s most famous musical artists. Performances are at the Rose History Auditorium located on the Marco Island Historical Museum campus

Tickets are on sale now for the Marco Island Historical Society’s 2024 “World Class Entertainment Series.”

It’s a series of tribute performances showcasing some of the world’s most famous musical artists. Performances are at the Rose History Auditorium located on the Marco Island Historical Museum campus.

Three tributes in one night

Jan. 24 – The opening night lineup will feature performances of hit tunes ranging from Billy Joel’s “Piano Man” to Cher’s “Half Breed” and Lady Gaga’s “Born this Way.”

Elvis has not left the building

Feb. 1 – World Champion tribute artist Ted Torres Martin’s portrayal of The King of Rock N’ Roll has been called one of the world’s top tributes — a title he earned in Memphis, Tennessee as recognized by Elvis Presley Enterprises. His vocals have been described as the closest to Elvis you will ever hear. He will perform some of the biggest Elvis Presley hits including “Burning Love,” “Jailhouse Rock,” “If I Can Dream” and more.

Essence of Motown

Feb. 6 – Back by popular demand, this tribute show showcases the music and culture with the celebration of Motown. Essence of Motown features Larry Johnson who has performed with The Drifters and The Temptations. This show pays homage to a golden era of music by bringing back the distinctive Motown sound of both of these famous groups as well as the Four Tops, The Miracles and other great groups.

A Tribute to Paul McCartney

Feb. 22 – Paul is All is the number one Paul McCartney tribute show in the country. John Babcock has been performing as Paul McCartney of the Beatles and touring the United States and Canada with the cast of Beatlemania, performing in the long-running Las Vegas show Legends of Concert.

The Rhythm Chicks – Great Girl Groups Through the Decades

Feb. 29 – This trio of performers pays tribute to the great girl groups and female entertainers of the 1940s to the present with wonderful harmonies, great choreography, and dazzling costumes. Performed to rave reviews in theaters, nightclubs, and on cruise ships throughout the country, this tribute show celebrates the Supremes, The Shirelles, The Crystals, The Pointer Sisters, Madonna, Gloria Estefan and many others.

The Ed Sullivan Variety Show presents “The Golden Age of Rock ‘n’ Roll”

March 12 – The Ed Sullivan’s All-Star Variety Show is a high-energy musical salute to some of entertainment’s most beloved stars. Talented Las Vegas tribute artists pay homage to Rock ‘n’ Roll greats Buddy Holly, The Big Bopper, Joe Cocker, The Blues Brothers, Hank Williams and Mick Jagger.

John Denver – Back Home Again

March 19 – Tom Becker, known as one of the best John Denver tribute artists in the U.S., has performed around the globe.

Donna Summer and Tina Turner

March 27 – The audience will experience the ultimate Tina Turner tribute and Donna Summer tribute at this show by tribute artist Latraia Savage.

Doors open at 6 p.m., curtain is at 6:30. Tickets are $50 per person. For tickets visit themihs.org or call 239-389-6447 for more information.

The Marco Island Historical Museum is located at 180 S. Heathwood Drive. The Museum is open Tuesday through Saturday, from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission is free, and the site is handicapped accessible. For general information visit themihs.org or call 239-389-6447.
